citations.narrative:
On July 27, 2025, both swift foxes escaped their enclosure overnight. The next morning one of the swift foxes was
observed running in the bison enclosure adjacent to the swift fox enclosure. The other swift fox escaped and has not been
recovered. The foxes had dug a hole from their outdoor enclosure under the dig barrier into the bison enclosure. The
facility set a trap and captured the male swift fox overnight. He was placed inside the swift fox indoor enclosure, but the
fox escaped through the window that night and also escaped his outdoor enclosure. The facility has had swift foxes in this
enclosure for many years with no escapes. Unlike the swift foxes in the past, these were wild caught and had only been in
this enclosure for three months. Despite placing traps, they have not been able to capture either swift fox. They were
spotted on trail cams on property up until August 31, 2025. They have not been observed since, but the facility continues
to place traps when weather permits. Animal escapes can be detrimental to their well-being. This can result in no access
to water, food, and possible injury and death. The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as
appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to
protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. The facility corrected this on July 30, 2025, by not putting any
swift foxes back into the enclosure.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
